intro: Plectritis macroptera var. patelliformis, commonly known as the Pacific coast blueweed, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, preferring sandy or gravelly soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal practices. The varietal form, patelliformis, is distinguished by its slightly rounded leaf shape compared to the typical form.
